reviewText: I had read a collection of interviews by Tarentino and wanted to revisit these movies. It is a good collection with 3 different DVDs.  Has commentary on each disk & trailers. This would be good for any private collection.
I think when a scene cannot be missed and you have to pause, that's intense. Excuse the punt, but I enjoyed the movie, it wasn't recommended, I'm glad I bought the 3PK
No problems with the copies!  You get a great deal on the three pack.  Worth the purchase and more.  Enjoy!
Being a Tarantino fan this purchase was to replace well worn VHS copies of these 3 movies. I would always give a thumbs up to anything he does.

Overall a great addition to any collection. If you are a fan of Quentin T then this is definately something you should pick up for yourself or that favorite person in your life. They will definately appreciate it.
All of the dvds are in great condition. Already watched every single one and I'm super happy about this purchase :)
Great value for 3 great movies! Buy it. Not Blu-Ray DVD pack but that is not a purchase concern. Gift idea for friends, family or yourself.
All of these movies are worth watching.  Pulp Fiction is a classic and Jackie Brown is a continuation ... though not as good as Pulp Fiction.  I have not had time to view the last movie in the set.

All three movies have terrific themes. One of them lags quite a bit in delivery style, but makes up for it in casting.
Frankly, Tarantino relies on superb casting to carry ocassionally lame plot lines .. but pulls it off splendidly.
In short, these are cult classics .. not Cinema Classics.
Ya like them, or ya don't.
I was very pleased to see my favourite movies in a 3 pack.  To purchase these movies separately, would have been a expensive endeavor.

For less than $5, free shipping, this was a steal. Took about a week and some change. I could have sworn that I bought this used but it came new, still in the plastic (no complaints!). The discs were unblemished in any way. I'm looking forward to the Tarantino experience this week. The man's a genius.

That last pic is just to show that the case is still normal sized, for 3 discs.
A must have for any crazed Tarantino fan!

Even if the quality of the videography isn't 4K and super stellar, for the $3.74 I paid, this was a great buy, especially for a Tarantino lover.

Spoiler warning-
I bought this mainly for Pulp Fiction, for that movie alone, the price was right.  Reservior Dogs was a little stupid, it felt like I was watching a stage play with every other word being obscene.  Jackie Brown was a little better, but the plot, sub-plot, mini-sub-plot, micro-mini-sub-plot, was just too twisted for most people to follow and enjoy.  The twists were overkill, with FEWER twists you have a much better movie.  (A little) "Less is more" is what this movie needed.  I'll enjoy Pulp Fiction much more often than the other two, while, to me, the other movies are "bonus" material.
